title: "How Did the Discovery of Visual Fascination Go Unnoticed and Why Was the Truth About Magnetism Ignored?"
first_phrase: In the last part of this text, the author reflects on a discovery he made regarding visual fascination on a subject in a wakeful state. He had blown on the eyes of a woman who seemed troubled, and she immediately opened them. He noticed that his gaze had something attractive, and the woman's eyes began to follow his. Another woman also fell under his influence. On his way home, he experienced a moment of cerebral overexcitement, believing he could captivate anyone with his gaze. In retrospect, the author wonders why no one has made the same discovery before.
content: Je me levai, le sujet se leva. De plus en plus étonné, je m’éloignai à reculons : le sujet marcha sur mes traces. Je venais de découvrir la fascination visuelle sur un sujet à l’état de veille. La seconde dame subit mon influence à peu près de la même façon. ________________ En rentrant chez moi,j’avais le vertige — il me semblait qu’il me suffirait de lancer un regard rapide aux passants pour les accrocher à ma prunelle, et que d’un geste à distance je pourrais arrêter les chevaux emportés. Mais cet état de surexcitation cérébrale dura peu. II Méditations rétrospectives sur la science et l’expérience Méditant alors, je me demandai comment il se pouvait qu’il ne se fût pas trouvé un homme capable d’imposer à jamais au monde la vérité qui venait de m’être révélée d’une façon aussi claire qu’inopinée.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the fascinating visual attraction upon subjects in a normal state has been discovered. However, the state of overexcitation lasted only for a short time as the truth about magnetic phenomena was difficult to assert due to the prevalence of falsified and exaggerated claims, which obfuscated the underlying sensical observations.
